events.title: Birth of Le Corbusier
events.description: Le Corbusier, a Swiss-French architect, designer, and urban planner, was born. He became a pioneer of modern architecture and had a profound influence on urban planning throughout the 20th century.
events.significance: Le Corbusier revolutionized architectural design, emphasizing functionality and simplicity, shaping modern architectural practices worldwide.

events.title: Che Guevara Captured in Bolivia
events.description: Revolutionary Che Guevara was captured by CIA-assisted Bolivian forces during a guerrilla campaign against the Bolivian government.
events.significance: His capture marked a significant turning point in Latin American revolutionary movements and foreshadowed his execution.

events.title: East Germany Adopts Capitalist Currency
events.description: East Germany officially adopted the Deutsche Mark as its new currency, marking a significant step towards German reunification.
events.significance: This monetary reform was crucial in the process leading to the reunification of East and West Germany, ending decades of division.

events.title: North Korea Claims Nuclear Test
events.description: North Korea claimed to have conducted its first nuclear test, causing international tension.
events.significance: This event marked a critical escalation in North Korea's nuclear program, affecting global security and diplomatic relations.
